Description:

The CFW is packed manually with minimal modifications of the OFW4.50 and only the needed PKGs were repacked with their matching headers, lv0 and the SPU loaders also properly packed with correct sections/compression. 
It does have all the basic patches from CFW4.46, the ToolBox was not added.
I built this last night before I go to sleep and installed it and tested it for 5 minutes only on my PS3, all seems fine and stable, but as usual with any CFW : USe it at your own Risk



Info:


Platform: PS3 
Release date: October 19, 2013 
Type: custom firmware CFW PS3 (CEX) 
Developer: Sony / Rogero 
Website: tortuga-cove.com 
Language: Multi

included Multiman 04.50.01 FULL 







The requirement for the firmware PS3: original firmware is not above 3.55 (OFW 3.55) or any of custom firmware CEX (CEX CFW) 


The Custom firmware can be installed directly from the XMB on OFW3.55 / CFW3.55 / CFW4.21 / CFW4.30 / CFW4.40 / CFW4.41 / CFW4.46 / CFW4.50 / Rebug / Rogero / HABIB

Features

ReactPSN works offline - no more logs into PSN 
noBD / noBT patches allow to put the firmware on the console with a broken blu-ray drive and bluetooth card 
This firmware can be safely placed directly from the XMB 
You can change the hard drive firmware and no problems will reset to a new HDD 
Patched LV1 LV2 to disable security 
Patched LV1 to support the peek / poke 
Patched LV1 to hash verification Core OS to prevent bric on daungreyzhenyh nedeheshirovannyh consoles 
Patched to support LV2 peek / poke 
QA Flag-and now included by default 
Software bypassing RSOD consoles are prone to it 
PSN / SEN works, but it is not recommended to use 
You can run all the games signed keys up to 4.50 without having to patch them





Installation:

"Method 1 
Remove the disc from BD drive 
Rename the downloaded firmware file Rogero CFW 4.50 v1.00.PUP to PS3UPDAT.PUP. 
Copy the firmware file PS3UPDAT.PUP to USB flash drive (FAT32) to a folder PS3/UPDATE. 
Insert the USB flash drive into the PS3. 
Turn on the PS3. 
On the PS3, select system updates, update from media and follow the instructions on the screen. 
Firmware is installed. 
Installing multiMAN completely



"Method 2 
Remove the disc from BD drive 
Rename the downloaded firmware file Rogero CFW 4.50 v1.00.PUP to PS3UPDAT.PUP. 
Copy the firmware file PS3UPDAT.PUP to USB flash drive (FAT32) to a folder PS3/UPDATE. 
Insert the USB flash drive into the PS3. 
Turn off the PS3. 
Press the power button and hold until you hear two beeps after which the PS3 will turn off, then release the button. 
Push the power button and hold it until you hear the first one short beep, followed by two short beeps, then release the button. 
Make all the instructions on the screen, select system update in the very last paragraph. 
PS3 some time off (do not touch the console at this point), and as a result will lead you to setup screen. 
Firmware is installed. 
Installing multiMAN completely
